"You can sleep on the bed."

"Yep!"

You took of your clothes, except your trousers and T-shirt, and laid down on the bed. The snow leopardess laid down behind you, close enough so you could feel her warm breath on your neck. 12532122212.title: That was unexpected

125321222122.content:
You woke up, cold sweating, breathing heavily and your heartbeat was fast. You were scared. Your whole body was tense, didn't listen to your orders to move, even how hard you tried. It was a nightmare, but not an ordinary nightmare. This nightmare was one of the worst. It seemed so real, it was more frightening, it was painful. You were killed in the nightmare. It wasn't a swift death. No. It was a slow and painful death. Ordinary nightmares and dreams end when you get hurt or are near death, but this one just continued.

You felt something weighting over your chest. You were less tense now, so you looked down to see the snow leopardess sleep soundly. The feeling of her warm and soft body on you, soothed your mind, forgetting the hideous nightmare. You lifted your right hand over to her back, petting her gently.

"Don't stop, please. It's so good." she purred. It looked like she was still asleep, but the smile on her lips revealed that she was indeed awake. You petted her back, while you drifted to thoughts about your family and friends. You missed them a little, but then you remembered why you left them. The whole family had a big fight, you with them, and it went overboard. Everyone shouted at each other, swearing at each other and, to top it of, getting violent. Throwing things, punching and kicking each other. You were lucky to just get a kick on your hip before you got outside. When you saw in the mirror, to where the fight was, your mother was on the floor, bleeding from her nose. You didn't want to see anymore of this brutality, so you ran into the forest. You could hear your father shouting at you in the distance, but you ran deeper into the forest, trying to get as far as possible. When the night came, it was then you found this cave.

Much have happened in a short time, so you took this moment of peace to swallow anything.

"Why'd you stop?" you heard.

"I just thought of what happened today." you replied.

"Oh... Okay... Sorry about it." she said.

You didn't answer. You continued petting her back. Reflecting over what have happened until now, you felt somewhat happy. Your family argued all the time and didn't pay much attention or simply didn't care about you. Good riddance. Now you met a snow leopardess who was friendly. She was cute too. It looked like she cared about you.

You looked down at the snow leopardess, who had fallen asleep again.

You tried to get into a comfortable position, but every time you got half ways into the position, you heard mumbling from the snow leopardess. Didn't want to wake her up, you'd got into the same position as before. On some magical way, the snow leopardess was in another position. She was now on top of you, her head on your chest and her arms around your neck. It was better, so you didn't think much about it and drifted to sleep.


The next morning you woke up alone. Was everything a dream? Was it just a figment of your imagination? No, it couldn't be. It seemed to real to be a dream. You stood up and looked around. In the corner where the bones and the fireplace was burning brightly at the center of the complex. You heard something on the outside of the cave. You heard the sound of footsteps and a sweet humming. Something was on it's way deeper into the cave. You put on your clothes as fast as you could, but when you where on your way to zip up your pants, something wet crashed on your back and two arms embraced you neck.

"Good morning!" the snow leopardess said happily.

"Good morning to you too." you said with a smile.

"Did you sleep well?" she asked

"I did! It was very comfortable" you replied

"That's great! Do you want to come out for some fresh air? The air in here can be a little humid."

"When you say it, it really is. It wouldn't be a bad idea to have some fresh air, I suppose."

You two walked back to the entrance of the cave. You took some small peeks at the snow leopardess at times. She was beautiful. Not only in body or mind, but also in movement and her every motion. They were perfectly balanced, without any edges. They were simply perfect. When you got out of the cave, you had to close your eyes for not getting blind by the bright light.

The weather was great. The sun was shining brightly, warming your skin. You could hear the birds singing in the distance, filling the air with joy.

When your eyes got accustomed to the bright sunlight, you saw the snow leopardess looking right at you, with a big smile.

"Do you want to come to the lake and go for a swim?" she asked

Before you can get up, a tall figure enters the chamber. There's enough lighting to make out his appearance: seven feet tall, blue, and wearing a loincloth. Blinking, you recognize him as Tsu'tey, the hardass Na'vi prince from James Cameron's Avatar. But wait, wasn't he both taller and killed?

"Greetings," he says to you, lowering himself into a sitting position. "I am Tsu'tey, one of the Na'vi of Pandora. I know you are human, but where are we? Is it a place you are familiar with? It cannot be Pandora, because the animals and plants look too different for me to be somewhere else on my home world. Are all humans as big as you? The ones I am familiar with, the ones who tried to destroy my world, were only half as tall as me, and yet you are much bigger than that."

As carefully as possible, you fill him in on what happened on Pandora, and do your best to answer his questions. He receives them pretty well, though it was very off-putting for him to realize he may be in a bizarre land of the dead, since he was technically killed.

Finally, after taking in your info, he says, "So my world was saved, and Jake Sully and Neytiri are happily united. I still don't understand how I can be on the human world if the one that existed in my time is a terrible shell of its former self." He pauses, and then looks you in the eye. "I have one last question. I despised humans when I was on Pandora, but since I grew to know Jake Sully, he became a brother to me, and I find that I am attracted to humans, even males such as you.
